column5: I see lots of people asking whats the best way to rig a line up for pike.  well check out this teaser video get creative and make one of your own.  i suggest rigging your line with a quick strike rig. 0% fatality on the pike .  thats if you want to C&R  <object width="420" height="315"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OUZIg39sXD4?version=3&hl=fr_FR"></param><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OUZIg39sXD4?version=3&hl=fr_FR"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OUZIg39sXD4?version=3&hl=fr_FR" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420" height="315" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>
I'd like some close up pics of that bracket.  Very cool idea.
Ht has one like that at canadian tire...  But the ht version has a base...
Not sure the price...  But here's a pic...  Now that I've seen it set up it looks kinda tippy...
Isn't that the point of a tip-up?
I mean that the hole apparatus would fall over...
All you need is a decent base, it wouldn't go anywhere...  I think I might run something like that for whities this year..  I'll have to get the oldman to whip something up in the workshop.

NOW your talking! i mean it took me about an houre to make five!  WOW the one from ct takes WAY to much space man when i walk 30 minutes on a lake i like to travel light and that bracket seems WAY to complicated for nothing.
You could even use an elastic band with some weights on the end to really make it balanced.
I think if you mixed some snow/slush over it and packed it it would be okay.
i just add more sleeves but seriously... when you set your drag to nothing. the fish can run with the line freely!
